p: If bacterial infection is suspected in the transplant recipient, empiric broad-spectrum antibiotics are used, until sensitivities are identified. Aminoglycosides are usually avoided due to their nephrotoxicity particularly if calcineurin inhibitors are being used for immunosuppression. Common organisms isolated in bacteremic patients are methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus, Klebsiella pneumoniae, and Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
